tCZLcC412_5FG0xHM.name: Code of Honor (Confucian)
tCZLcC412_5FG0xHM.notes: Show humanity to others, especiallythose who owe you duties; goodwill is more important thanfollowing exact rules. Respect society and its customs and traditions. Perform your duties to the emperor, your parents, your spouse, your older siblings, and your friends; this includesduties to the dead, even remote ancestors.

tib2VS6O6TNHC9U-7.name: Code of Honor (Xia)
tib2VS6O6TNHC9U-7.notes: The way of Chinese knights-errant inthe early empire. You must be skilled at arms. You must keepyour word, honor your pledges, be humble, and uphold justicefor those in need. You must be brave and not spare yourselfharm to help others. You must be willing to use force, but alsoto show restraint when force isn’t needed. You must respectand honor your teacher.
